verses.kjv: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
verses.ct: How long will you ignore me, LORD? Forever? How long will you withdraw your favor from me?

verses.kjv: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
verses.ct: How long must I wrestle with my own thoughts, carrying grief in my heart every day? How long will my enemy have the upper hand over me?

verses.kjv: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
verses.ct: Pay attention and answer me, LORD my God. Restore the light in my eyes before I drift into the sleep of death,

verses.kjv: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
verses.ct: before my enemy can say, 'I defeated him,' and my opponents celebrate my downfall.

verses.kjv: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
verses.ct: But I have put my trust in your mercy; my heart will celebrate your salvation.

verses.kjv: I will sing unto the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
verses.ct: I will sing to the LORD, because he has been so generous to me.
